comments.commentBody: Yes, the Moderator, Elaine Kijano, was the worst that I've seen in debates. She can read and do nothing else.
money for ESL comes before money to fight ISIS?
Absolutely no grist or actual content whatsoever. Like playing softball with melons and no actual rules. With a fake umpire. Strictly reality tv. And really awful reality tv at that.

I was very disappointed at the weight given to questions of terrorisms nd foreign policy at the expense of social issues.  There was the de rigeur abortion question and a bit about policing which triggered fulsome rhetoric from Pence and little more, but no inquiries into LGBTQ rights (or Pence's history of supporting legislation that allows discrimination, or his preference for taking money from AIDS medication and putting it toward "conversion" therapy), gun safety and control, education equity and funding (given Trump's plan to abolish the Department of Education and thus a crucial source of funding for disabled students, ESL learners, and the poor), environment and energy issues, climate change and science in general, on and on.  I was hugely disappointed.

"The Clinton Foundation is improving the lives of poor people all over the world"

The only poor people being helped by the Clinton Foundation are the "dead broke" Clintons.
Was very surprised when Kaine missed the opportunity to refer to the New York State Attorney General's order to stop the Trump Foundation fund-raising activities due to illegal Trump self-dealings

"Mike Pence appears to not even understand the meaning of 'charity' in spite of his professed Christianity."

Christian countries clearly demonstrated their charity since 9/11 as they created extreme misery in countries such as Iraq, Syria and Libya which had nothing to do with 9/11.

I enjoyed Mike Pence trying to hold out the Trump Foundation as a model of charity, despite the New York State Attorney General's order to stop its fund-raising activities due to illegal Trump self-dealings.

Pence simultaneously tried to smear the Clinton Foundation with a right-wing propaganda piece by stating the Clinton Foundation donates just 10% to charity - a wild-eyed lie and slander

http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/statements/2016/aug/25/reince-pr...

The American Institute of Philanthropy’s Charity Watch, reached the same conclusion. It has given the Clinton Foundation an A rating and says it spends only 12% of the money it raises on "overhead."

"The Clinton Foundation is an excellent charity," Charity Watch president Daniel Borochoff said Aug. 24, 2016, on CNN. "They are able to get 88 percent of their spending to bona fide program services and their fundraising efficiency is really low. It only costs them $2 to raise $100."

The Clinton Foundation is improving the lives of poor people all over the world; the Trump Foundation appears to be another Trump fraud.

And Mike Pence can't tell the difference between the two.

Mike Pence appears to not even understand the meaning of 'charity' in spite of his professed Christianity.

Mike Pence appears to be as big of a bold-faced liar as Donald Trump is.

Grand Old Prevaricators 2016

Ar:
"Second, if it is true that optics trump substance in these affairs then it's probably best to just ignore these affairs."

Optics, the bright shiny object that seems to draw a lot of attention this cycle, was taken to task long ago with the old saying, "Never judge a book by it's cover".
But...we do seem to do quite a lot of judging!

People in this comments thread keep stating that optics matter more than substance in these debates, so that's why Kaine didn't have a good night. First, speak for yourself. Second, if it is true that optics trump substance in these affairs then it's probably best to just ignore these affairs.

That argument kind of reminds me of what people were saying earlier this year about the South Carolina GOP primary that turned out to be Jeb Bush's last stand. Everybody talked about how utterly dirty and down in the gutter GOP primary campaigns tended to be in South Carolina, so different from Iowa and New Hampshire. Well then, why give a damn about the outcome there?
As a Clinton supporter, you must be extremely happy that Mitch and Mike is unfortunately not the Republican ticket this time around.  They would be up by 50 points.

Pence. It was all facade. And there was not a moment when I thought that a real person existed behind that facade.

In that respect he totally captures the reality of conservative politics.
Pants tried to make himself out at the Ronell Reagan by saying " there he goes again".  Nobody's mentioned that; it was so embarrassing.

To those of you who knew nothing about Mike Pence before watching this debate: As someone who lived in Indiana, allow me to make something clear about Mr. Pence.

Mr. Pence is a Tea Party politician. His views are comparable to Ann Coulter's or Rush Limbaugh's. He's possibly to the right of former Indiana candidate for senator Richard Mourdock, who said "God intends rapes to happen". He made many Indiana residents miss the previous governor, who was part of the Bush administration.

So please don't be fooled by the understated demeanor. That's just typical for Indiana politicians, where polite tends to be valued in public. The guy is an extremist.
Say Clinton lacks stamina after she faints or call an overweight woman who participated in a murder fat = sexist. Making fun of Trump/Pence about hair = legitimate. Got it.

That's the best you can come up with ? His hair ? Really his hair ? He looked like a very well groomed gentleman. There is no perfect candidate out there, we have Clinton and we have Trump . If Trump' s taxes is all we have to worry about we all would sleep peacefully tonight. What do people not get that Hillary Clinton has already put this nation at great risk. If those emails contained yoga and wedding plans why were they bleached and some idiot took a hammer and bashed some with all this happening after they had been subpoenaed ? What is it you just don't get ? She's had almost 30 years to prove herself , well yes she did prove herself  hasn't she ?

"One question I'd love to have the press answer is if Pence wears a rug."
What in God's name does that have to do with anything of substance? Oh, wait... Do you have a coiffure fetish? That might explain it... One last thing: Promise not to vote...

I'm not sure how it cuts for undecided or low information voters. Kaine would have won if it was judged on points and logic.

However I'm not sure there was a winner in terms of TV image and style because different portions of the audience would have different preferences and argument and logic might not count for much.

Among voters who are already decided or who favor one site or the other I'd guess all would see a winner in the candidate from their own favored side.

One question I'd love to have the press answer is if Pence wears a rug. it sure looked like it and whether real or not I found his hair very distracting. Although knowing about his hair shouldn't affect votes and might lead to some jokes or reactions linked to Trump's focus on women's appearances, it would be interesting to know.

Watch this week some of the denials of Pence regarding Trump's statements skewered by video tape of Trump making the statements that Pence claims Trump never made.  Also Kaine baiting Pence into making these denials has provided more fodder for Clinton TV ads.

It was shocking after the debate to hear commentators, even on MSNBC, saying Pence won the debate. No, Pence lied repeatedly to Americans by denying that Donald Trump and he made numerous statements that Kaine asked him about. Such commentators do a disservice to Americans when they overlook baldfaced lies and declare a lying candidate the winner.

Earlier in the day some of these same commentators were having fun showing us person-in-the-street interviews in which few people even knew who Kaine and Pence were. So, they might have realized these Americans would not know whether the candidates' statements were true or false.

But the commentators have become so desensitized by the volume of lies from the Trump campaign that they discount them and tonight gave a pass to Pence who was probably believed by many viewers tonight when he denied that he or Donald Trump made statements that are all on tape.

A faulty judgement of our commentators went well beyond grading on the curve in favor of Trump. Repeated lying in a debate should disqualify a candidate, not make him the winner because he remained cool when lying, looked like a statesman, didn't interrupt as much, was polite! Good Heavens journalists, you are supposed to be professionals. You are supposed to use your knowledge to help Americans understand the differences between the candidates, not to get so jaded by lies and distanced from the information needs of average Americans that you mislead them.
How did Pence get selected as VP? He's got governing experience and is from the Midwest. Plus, of all the speculated candidates, he was the first to say yes.
I too listened to MSNBC.  It sounded like the Trump Foundation made a "yuge" contribution to the network.

Pence came across as a smoother operator, but then again Trump is a smooth operator too. In the worst sense.

Pence's equanimity still can't hide the fact that he's trying to defend the indefensible.

Pence lied through his teeth, repeatedly. He never answered a single question. And while he was claiming that Trump didn't run an insult-driven campaign, Trump was tweeting that Kaine looked like a character from Batman. Pence knows this about Trump and he kept on insisting that Trump's own words had never been said, didn't meant what they said, etc.

Not very adult in my world.
Because he was always interrupted, both by Kaine and the moderator.
Plus nearly every single out of Pence's mouth was a lie.  It's a crime against the voting public that there is not live fact-checking on the screen during every single debate.

So Lester Holt and Matt Lauer get slammed for not trying to control the debate, but this woman is a scold? Okaaaay. She did, in fact, try to engage them. Please go back to the tape and watch her re-ask one particular question at least three times of Pence and Pence simply refuses to answer. (Question asked what Pence would say to a colleague who reported being stopped by police 7 times in one year.) very hard to *not* seem like a scold when Pence refused again and again to even answer the question.
You said the exact same thing, just reversed and by party. Kaine/Clinton = emotional/stoic, Pence/Trump = stoic/emotional.

If VP picks are supposed to complement the candidates, inter-alia, Kaine succeeded and Pence failed.  Kaine was unguarded and emotive, which pairs well with Mrs. Clinton's more cerebral presentation.  But Pence was a strong contrast to Trump and drew more attention to Trump's flaws.  Pence's scripted expressions and unwavering positions just emphasized how undisciplined and all-over-the-place Trump is.
Oh! A kill switch for the microphones. I LOVE this idea! Yes, please!
You assume the moderators are their to impose fairness instead of shilling for Democrats.

I, also, was not impressed "by either of these guys", but did find it refreshing to get, finally, some different voices saying different things.  Unfortunately, these two are running for the "oblivion" office - the Vice Presidency.  We will seldom hear from them, or about them, unless a catastrophe occurs, or a revolution.  Neither of which would surprise me.......

I wasn't impressed with either of these guys, or the moderator. I can't stand it when politicians talk curlicues around a direct question before even getting close to a point.  The interruptions and talk-overs were beyond annoying. And clearly, moderators need to be armed with a very large gavel and/or kill switch for the mikes.

"Presidential" I assume means TV ready, since his qualifications are scary bad.

"seeming presidential" - great reason to vote on a person. not.

If I was Pence, my response would have been. We live in a capitalist system. Competition is how it operates. Any business person must take advantage of any laws in order to be competitive. Why? Because the competition will. If you as a business person don't, you lose and go out of business. Simple.

Best moment. Pence: "Donald Trump supports the troops."
Kaine; "He doesn't pay his taxes."
There was a moderator?
But Trump is NOT a lunatic and is a paragon of American values? This just demonstrates the Twilight Zone thought processes of Trump supporters.
Trump/Pence Supreme Court appointments can overturn Roe v Wade - and they have already said that's exactly who they will appoint.

I found the moderator in this debate completely inept and lacking a personality that projects authority. She lost control over the candidates in the first five minutes of the confrontation. Both candidates came with obviously pre-canned arguments and she let both of them repeat the same lines over and over, side-stepping the important issues and questions.
I hope that the women of this nation will check out Mr. Pence's record before they vote (or decide to stay home on election day) and see what is going to await for them and their daughters if a person like him will determine their future health and personal lives.

...an excellent politician to have gotten as far as he did. And very skilled at saying absolutely nothing. But as with any vacuously empty hat with a far right conservative and faux religious agenda, he's run out of gas. Indiana doesn't even want him (which says a lot) so he had nowhere else to go. So he joins with the polar opposite of his conservative religious beliefs and one of the most loathsome individuals ever to run for public office. As you've noticed...it's kind of perfect.
I guess it all depends upon each of our determination of the meaning of the words "excellent politician".  There are far too many politicians and too few statesmen.......

Defunding the indefensible is right. And he did it by obfuscating and telling his own lies. Plenty of "side by side" videos today of him denying trump had said something, then video of trump saying it.

GOOD politicians defend their position with facts and ideas. Slick snake oil salesmen defend their positions by lying and obfuscating. Pence is the later.

Pence did an excellent job defending an indefensible Trump.  He avoided answering question by giving very long "answers" that did not answer the questions at all.  In essence, Pence ran out the clock.  He is an excellent politician.

At this point, I am not sure what is more scary.

Mr. Trump's bombastic bluster of lies within an alternate reality universe
( or )
Mr. Pence's soft monotone radio voice yes-man utterances of the same that have a greater chance to convince people on the fence that he is a caring conservative ( and then actually vote for the ticket )

Pence rambled on and on and on, in an oily-smooth voice - Kaine had to interrupt him, or he would have never been able to get a word in edgewise.  I was - well, not surprised, but disappointed - at how easily Penced lied, over and over again, just like Trump.  No sirree, Trump never said Putin's a great leader!  No sirree, Trump never said that Russia wouldn't invade Ukraine (after Russia was already in Ukraine with an invasioin force).  Sigh.  GOP - party of shameless, soulless liars.
Is this indicative of our values? Are demeanor and delivery more important than content and honesty? For me, looking through the smokescreens is more important than anything else.

Honest? Have you looked at any of the fact-checking sites? Pence lied every single time he opened his mouth, and he couldn't answer a single question directly.

I was really disappointed there were no questions on LGBTQ issues, gun safety and control, education equity and funding, mental health care, caring for people who will be out of luck should Trump repeal the Affordable Care Act, the environment, climate change, actual science (Pence believes creationism should be mandated to be taught in public schools), and so much more. There needed to be coverage of these issues to clearly show how different the country would look under these two different candidates.

This debate was excruciating. Mike Pence somehow came off as the adult in the room, even though so many things he said were demonstrably false. Tim Kaine was good but went down the same minor roads too often. And kept interrupting. It would have been nice if he kept pressing Pence on the factual basis for his statements. Some Pence statements were ones that have been discredited so thoroughly that you could only consider him to be lying.
He accepted it, and puts up with Trump for one reason: To set himself up for 2020 and beyond.

The fact that Mike Pence refused to specifically endorse - or even directly address - many, if not all of Donald Trump's positions begs the question, why did he accept the nomination in the first place?  I believe that a lack of unity was on display that should have Republicans questioning the choice of running mate.
